  • Element
 
Package it.phibonachos.andromeda

Annotation Type Validate

@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface Validate

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements 
    Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
    String[] alternatives
    Alternatives clause defines fallback properties for the annotated one, it also define a topological hierarchy in property graph.
    String[] boundTo
    BoundTo clause defined which properties are closely connected to the annotated property.
    String[] conflicts
    Conflicts clause defines a set of properties that shouldn't be set if annotated property is set.
    String[] context
    Contexts clause associate annotated property to a specific contexts, contexts are used by macro functions ValidateEvaluator.onlyContexts(String...) and ValidateEvaluator.ignoreContexts(String...).
    boolean mandatory
    Mandatory clause states if annotated property can be whether nullable or not.
    String[] requires
    Requires clause defines target property's dependencies.
    Class<? extends MultiValueConstraint> with
    With clause states which class must be use in order to validate annotated property.

  • Element Details

    • with

      Class<? extends MultiValueConstraint> with

      With clause states which class must be use in order to validate annotated property. All validation classes extends abstract class MultiValueConstraint, and expose a validate(T target), which wraps validation algorithm.

      Returns:
      a validator object
      Default:
      it.phibonachos.andromeda.types.mono.NotNullValue.class

    • mandatory

      boolean mandatory

      Mandatory clause states if annotated property can be whether nullable or not. Mandatory clause's behaviour can be altered using contexts or Validate.Ignore.

      Returns:
      true if validate field is mandatory
      Default:
      false

    • alternatives

      String[] alternatives

      Alternatives clause defines fallback properties for the annotated one, it also define a topological hierarchy in property graph. Alternatives plays a crucial role in mandatory properties as they will be validated (inheriting the mandatory clause), if the mandatory property will result not set. If at least one of the properties listed will result valid, the target property will result valid as well.

      Returns:
      a set of viable alternatives to current method
      Default:
      {}

    • conflicts

      String[] conflicts

      Conflicts clause defines a set of properties that shouldn't be set if annotated property is set.

      Returns:
      a set of conflictual fields to current method
      Default:
      {}

    • requires

      String[] requires

      Requires clause defines target property's dependencies. Validation will result valid only if all requirements are met.

      Returns:
      a set of requirements for current method
      Default:
      {}

    • boundTo

      String[] boundTo

      BoundTo clause defined which properties are closely connected to the annotated property. During evaluation boundTo properties values will be used in order to emit a verdict, properties annotated with a boundTo clause, must use a validation class which extends MultiValueConstraint or at least CoupleConstraint.

      Returns:
      a set of properties bounded to the validation of current method
      Default:
      {}

    • context

      String[] context

      Contexts clause associate annotated property to a specific contexts, contexts are used by macro functions ValidateEvaluator.onlyContexts(String...) and ValidateEvaluator.ignoreContexts(String...).

      Returns:
      a set of contexts in which current property is included
      Default:
      {}
